condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2020, the access to inclusive early learning services in rural municipalities is increased, especially for children with disabilities.

description.narrative: UNICEF continued to work on improving access to and quality of inclusive early learning services in rural municipalities, especially for children with disabilities. The evaluation of the project “Supporting Alternative Preschool Services in Small Communities in Lori Region” was completed in 2019 generating more evidence on effectiveness of the alternative preschool services in consolidated small communities, with recommendations for the scaling-up at national level. In 2020, in partnership with the Government more alternative preschool services will be established ensuring that the focus is kept on equity, inclusion and quality in the process of implementation. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:19/01/2020

title.narrative: Number of rural settlements with funding of alternative early learning services

baseline.value: 13 rural settlements have funding of alternative pre-school services

target.value: 2020:25 total rural settlements have funding of alternative pre-school services

actual.value: 2020:4 additional new alternative pre-school services were established in four rural settlements.

title.narrative: Number of children with special educational needs in preschools
Existence of policies on inclusive ECD covering particularly children with disabilities and other marginalized children

target.value: 2020:National policy (Law) on inclusive ECD is endorsed

actual.value: 2019:Law on PS Education endorsed by the government and submitted to the Parliament for approval in 2020
